alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Fergus County below 4500ft; Hill County; Northern Blaine County; Snowy and Judith Mountains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 14 at 1:29PM MST until January 15 at 11:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST MONDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MONDAY TO 11 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 60 below zero. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine County, Hill County, Northern Blaine County, Fergus County below 4500ft, and Snowy and Judith Mountains. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 11 AM MST Monday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 11 AM Monday to 11 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. Wind chill values may fall to extremely dangerous levels.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Fergus County below 4500ft; Hill County; Northern Blaine County; Snowy and Judith Mountains
